content: criss cross crochet quilt abbreviations beg - beginning chain - chain single_crochet - single_crochet double_crochet - double_crochet slip_stitch - slip_stitch space - space blo - back loop only note this afghan is worked using worsted weight yarn in the colors specified with each project it is made up of solid color granny squares general directions are as follows below simply crochet the number of squares needed in the color required then assemble as described in instructions solid color granny finished square measures approximately 2 1/2 chain 4 join with a slip_stitch to first chain to form a ring round 1 chain 3 2 double_crochet in ring chain 1 3 double_crochet in ring chain 1 three times join with slip_stitch to top of beg chain 3 round 2 chain 3 turn 2 double_crochet in first chain 1 space chain 1 3 double_crochet in same chain 1 space chain 1 3 double_crochet chain 1 3 double_crochet in remaining 3 chain 1 sps chain 1 join with slip_stitch to top of beg chain 3 finish off weave in loose ends criss-cross afghan finished size approximately 46 by 58 materials needed 22 oz bright red worsted weight yarn 22 oz bright yellow worsted weight yarn 22 oz royal blue worsted weight yarn 24 oz black worsted weight yarn size g crochet hook or size needed for proper gauge tapestry needle afghan assembly using tapestry needle and appropriate color yarn and stitching through blo assemble afghan using the diagram on next page for placement border round 1 with black yarn join with a slip_stitch to any corner chain 1 space single_crochet around work 3 single_crochet in each corner chain 1 space join with slip_stitch to first single_crochet to join round 2 chain 3 turn double_crochet in each single_crochet around work 3 double_crochet in each corner join with slip_stitch to top of beg chain 3 to join round 3 chain 1 turn single_crochet in each double_crochet around work 3 single_crochet in each corner join with slip_stitch to first single_crochet to join rnds 4 & 5 repeat round 2 and 3 once finish off weave in loose ends every effort has been made to ensure the accuracy of these instructions we cannot be responsible for human error differences in
